explanation: The cast-to-void expression statements (e.g. "(void) upload_data;") are executed no-op expressions whose removal would not change the program’s observable behaviour (the parameter is a normal non-volatile function parameter and the expression has no side-effects). By the literal wording of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), these statements constitute dead code. Therefore agent A’s characterization is correct. (Note: in practice the (void)param idiom is commonly used to suppress compiler warnings; if compliance is required one should instead use an allowed mechanism such as compiler-specific unused-attribute, omit the parameter name where language/ABI allows, or document an approved deviation.)
